Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பகைமையும் கேண்மையும் கண்ணுரைக்கும் கண்ணின் வகைமை உணர்வார்ப் பெறின்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The eye speaks out the hate or friendly soul of man; To those who know the eye's swift varying moods to scan.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: An extreme close-up on a pair of human eyes.
Layered_Composition.Midground: The eyes are shown in a state of transformation. On the left, the pupil and iris morph into a sharp, aggressive symbol, like a dagger, clearly communicating hatred ('பகைமை'). On the right, the same eye morphs its pattern into a warm, welcoming, open hand, clearly communicating friendship ('கேண்மை').
Layered_Composition.Background: A wise observer, who can understand the language of the eyes ('கண்ணின் வகைமை உணர்வார்'), is shown watching this transformation and understanding the person's true feelings instantly.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: To one who knows how to read them, the eyes themselves will speak and reveal whether a person feels hatred or friendship.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The literal transformation of the eye's iris into symbols of hate and friendship is the central, surreal metaphor.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The 'hate' eye has a cold, sharp, reddish light. The 'friendship' eye has a warm, soft, golden light.

Technical_Cues.Camera: An extreme macro close-up of the eye, capturing the impossible, symbolic transformation.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with detailed and surreal iris effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The light emanates from the eye itself, changing with the emotion.

Cultural_Anchors: The eye speaks hatred and friendship ('பகைமையும் கேண்மையும் கண் உரைக்கும்')
For those who understand the eye's nature ('கண்ணின் வகைமை உணர்வார்')
The eye as a window to the soul.
